result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik Pawlowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Erik Pawlowski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Erik Pawlowski was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Erik Pawlowski was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 1 with prejudice.
Court dismisses Count 2 without prejudice.
Defendant to report to Probation today September 23, 2015 by 11:30 a.m.
May earn early discharge from Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.

-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested by Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-NO ABUSIVE CONTACT with J. Hansen.
-Apology letter within 30 days.
-Restorative Justice Program if requested by Victim.
-Maintain employment.
-Appear in Court October 19, 2015 at 8:45 a.m.
-Random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA within 30 days if requested and follow any recommended treatment.

Probation review hearing at 10-19-2015 08:45 am

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Erik  Pawlowski appeared. Case called at 10:20 am. There is an agreement. ADA Correll files amended information and states agreement.  Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for amended count three and amended count four, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of count three and amended count four. Counts one and two are dismissed. Count one with prejudice. Count two without prejudice. Parties make sentencing arguements. Victim makes statement. Defendant makes statement. Court orders 3 years probation:
Count 3 w/h - 120 Days Jail STAYED
Count 4 i/s - 90 Days Jail
- Court Costs
- DNA Surcharge; Apply Bond
- AODA within 30 Days if requested
- Psychological/ Psychiatric Evaluation if requested
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearm
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- No Abusive contact with J. Hansen
- Apology Letter within 30 Days
- Restorative Justice if requested
- Maintain Employment
- Appear in court on 10/19/2015 at 8:45 am
- Random UA's and PBT's
- Sign up for probation by 11:30 am on 9/23/2015
- Pay Supervision Fees.
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- May earn early discharge from probation  Probation review hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:45 am.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Erik  Pawlowski appeared. Case called at 4:40 pm. Court reviews file. Atty Caton makes statement. FPT date already set. Address confirmed. Bond continues. km

** AMENDED **

X__ SIGNATURE BOND:   __ Defendant and/or  __ Surety guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $4000.00
and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jillian H.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Eron H.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Ms. J. Hansen to contact victim witness every Mon. by 10:00am. 

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Evenson, ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Erik  Pawlowski appeared. Case called at 9:03. ADA Correll updates the court as to the victim statement. Atty. Caton updates the court, DE will be attending a 6 week program for anger management. Atty. Caton requests 8 weeks. ADA Correll requests that the victim to contact victim witness weekly.  Address confirmed. Atty. Caton responds to discovery and the inaudible discovery.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 04:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Pre-trial conference on June 5, 2015 at 08:45 am.

CO:Commissioner Heckmann for Judge Vlack, DAR:Electronic Recording, Clerk: Liddle. ,ADA:  Jennifer Anne Bork   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Erik  Pawlowski appeared. Probation officer Ben Anderson present. Victim also present.  Case called at 11:21 a.m. Atty Caton has copy of information. Waive reading, Waive speedy trial. NG plea. Requesting bond condition of the no contact order be lifted and changed to no abusive contact.  Probation Agent Anderson makes statement. ADA Bork directs Agent Anderson. Atty Caton requesting statement from victim. Victim Jillian Hanson makes statement. Jillian has completed program at Turning Point. Employer Robert Schultz of defendant makes statement. Court notes has petition for modification for bond. Atty Caton Motion to Amend to no abusive contact. ADA Bork makes arguement. Asking for domestic violence class to be completed before reconsideration. Atty Caton gives arguement. Court will grant motion and amend to no abusive contact. Court requesting victim make weekly contact with Victim Witness office. hml  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Caton makes bond arguement. Court requests that Turning Point completion before bond is modified. Bond remains. km  Arraignment scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Appointing Atty Caton. km
